cosmos.base.v1beta1.Coin.title: Coin
cosmos.base.v1beta1.Coin.description: Coin defines a token with a denomination and an amount. NOTE: The amount field is an Int which implements the custom method signatures required by gogoproto.

flow_id.description: get the latest response value from other flow, optional

response_index.description: index of the message response, optional

value_type.description: can be anything from sdk.Int, sdk.Coin, sdk.Coins, string, []string, []sdk.Int

operator.description: enum AfterGetValueOperator {   PARSE = 0;   MULITPLY = 1;   DIVIDE = 2;   SUBSTRACT = 3;   ADD = 4; }  Comparison operators that can be used for various types.

icq_config.description: bool calculate_difference = 7; //True: Calculate the difference with the previous value.  config of ICQ to perform

intento.intent.v1.Comparison.title: Comparison
intento.intent.v1.Comparison.description: Comparison is checked on the response in JSON before execution of flow and outputs true or false

feedback_loops.description: Replace value with value from message or response from another flow’s latest output

stop_on_success_of.description: optional array of dependent intents that when executing succesfully, stops execution

stop_on_failure_of.description: optional array of dependent intents that when not executing succesfully, stops execution

skip_on_failure_of.description: optional array of dependent intents that should be executed succesfully after their latest call before execution is allowed

skip_on_success_of.description: optional array of dependent intents that should fail after their latest call before execution is allowed

use_and_for_comparisons.description: True: Use AND for combining comparisons. False: Use OR for combining comparisons.

intento.intent.v1.ExecutionConditions.title: Execution Conditions
intento.intent.v1.ExecutionConditions.description: ExecutionConditions provides execution conditions for the flow

save_responses.description: if true, the flow response outputs are saved and can be used in logic

updating_disabled.description: if true, the flow is not updatable

stop_on_success.description: If true, will execute until we get a successful Flow, if false/unset will always execute

stop_on_failure.description: If true, will execute until successful Flow, if false/unset will always execute

stop_on_timeout.description: If true, will stop if message times oiut

fallback_to_owner_balance.description: If true, owner account balance is used when trigger account funds run out

intento.intent.v1.ExecutionConfiguration.title: Execution Configuration
intento.intent.v1.ExecutionConfiguration.description: ExecutionConfiguration provides the execution-related configuration of the flow

flow_id.description: flow to get the latest response value from, optional

msgs_index.description: index of the msg to replace

msg_key.description: key of the message to replace (e.g. Amount[0].Amount, FromAddress)

value_type.description: can be anything from sdk.Int, sdk.Coin, sdk.Coins, string, []string, []sdk.Int

icq_config.description: bool calculate_difference = 7; //True: calculate the difference with the previous value instead of using the value directly.  config of ICQ to perform

intento.intent.v1.FeedbackLoop.title: Feedback Loop
intento.intent.v1.FeedbackLoop.description: Replace value with value from message or response from another flow’s latest output before execution

type_url.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent the fully qualified name of the type (as in `path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form (e.g., leading "." is not accepted). In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows: * If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed. * An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]   value in binary format, or produce an error. * Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the   URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any   lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved   on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage   breaking changes.) Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server implementations and no plans to implement one. Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

items.title: Any
items.description: `Any` contains an arbitrary serialized protocol buffer message along with a URL that describes the type of the serialized message. Protobuf library provides support to pack/unpack Any values in the form of utility functions or additional generated methods of the Any type. Example 1: Pack and unpack a message in C++.     Foo foo = ...;     Any any;     any.PackFrom(foo);     ...     if (any.UnpackTo(&foo)) {       ...     } Example 2: Pack and unpack a message in Java.     Foo foo = ...;     Any any = Any.pack(foo);     ...     if (any.is(Foo.class)) {       foo = any.unpack(Foo.class);     }     // or ...     if (any.isSameTypeAs(Foo.getDefaultInstance())) {       foo = any.unpack(Foo.getDefaultInstance());     }  Example 3: Pack and unpack a message in Python.     foo = Foo(...)     any = Any()     any.Pack(foo)     ...     if any.Is(Foo.DESCRIPTOR):       any.Unpack(foo)       ...  Example 4: Pack and unpack a message in Go      foo := &pb.Foo{...}      any, err := anypb.New(foo)      if err != nil {        ...      }      ...      foo := &pb.Foo{}      if err := any.UnmarshalTo(foo); err != nil {        ...      } The pack methods provided by protobuf library will by default use 'type.googleapis.com/full.type.name' as the type URL and the unpack methods only use the fully qualified type name after the last '/' in the type URL, for example "foo.bar.com/x/y.z" will yield type name "y.z". JSON ==== The JSON representation of an `Any` value uses the regular representation of the deserialized, embedded message, with an additional field `@type` which contains the type URL. Example:     package google.profile;     message Person {       string first_name = 1;       string last_name = 2;     }     {       "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.profile.Person",       "firstName": <string>,       "lastName": <string>     } If the embedded message type is well-known and has a custom JSON representation, that representation will be embedded adding a field `value` which holds the custom JSON in addition to the `@type` field. Example (for message [google.protobuf.Duration][]):     {       "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.protobuf.Duration",       "value": "1.212s"     }

intento.intent.v1.FlowInfo.title: Flow Info
intento.intent.v1.FlowInfo.description: FlowInfo stores the info for the flow

query_key.description: key in the store that stores the query e.g. stakingtypes.GetValidatorKey(validatorAddressBz)

flow_funds_commission.description: Commision rate percentage for returning remaining funds in flow fee account after final execution, e.g. 100 = 1X, 250 = 250

flow_flex_fee_mul.description: Multiplier to the flexible flow gas fee in promille, e.g. 1000 = 1X, 2500 = 2,5x

burn_fee_per_msg.description: Fixed burn fee per message execution to burn native denom

gas_fee_coins.description: Array of denoms that can be used for fee payment together with an amount

relayer_rewards.description: relayer rewards in uinto for each message type 0=SDK,1=Wasm, 2=Osmo. Rewards are in uinto and topped up in the module account by alloc module.

intento.intent.v1.Params.title: Params
intento.intent.v1.Params.description: Params defines the params for activeness of Flows on governance proposals.

intento.intent.v1.Sequence.title: Sequence
intento.intent.v1.Sequence.description: Sequence id and value of a counter
